alert.note: Alert for Del Norte (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 01 at 5:30PM PDT until September 01 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Eureka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Smith River and Slater burn scar in... Northeastern Del Norte County in northwestern California... * Until 1100 PM PDT. * At 530 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Smith River and Slater Burn Scar. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Smith River Complex. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Smith River and Slater Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Smith River and Slater Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Del Norte County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Smith River and Slater Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety.
